SEARCH

Class EmployeeDAO

java.lang.Object
EmployeeDAO
public class EmployeeDAO extends Object
Author: Alejandro Zubillaga Course: 202430-CEN-3024C-31950 Date: Jun 1, 2024 Software Development I EmployeeDAO Class This class is responsible for interacting with the HR database to perform CRUD (Create, Read, Update, Delete) operations on employee data. It establishes a connection to the MySQL database, and provides methods to create, retrieve, update, and delete employee records. The EmployeeDAO class is used by the main application to manage employee information.

  • Constructor Details

    • EmployeeDAO

      public EmployeeDAO(String dbUrl, String dbUser, String dbPassword)
      Constructor for the EmployeeDAO class. Establishes a connection to the HR database using the provided URL, username, and password.
      Parameters:
      dbUrl - the database URL
      dbUser - the database user
      dbPassword - the database password

  • Method Details

    • createEmployee

      public void createEmployee(Employee employee)
      createEmployee: Creates a new employee record in the database. This method does not return anything (void)
      Parameters:
      employee - the Employee object containing the employee's information

    • getEmployeeByID

      public Employee getEmployeeByID(int employeeID)
      getEmployeeByID: Retrieves an employee record from the database based on the employee's ID. This method returns an Employee object if a matching record is found in the database, or null if no record is found.
      Parameters:
      employeeID - the unique identifier of the employee
      Returns:
      the Employee object containing the employee's information, or null if the employee is not found

    • updateEmployee

      public void updateEmployee(Employee employee)
      updateEmployee: Updates an existing employee record in the database. This method does not return anything (void)
      Parameters:
      employee - the Employee object containing the updated employee information

    • deleteEmployeeByID

      public void deleteEmployeeByID(int employeeID)
      deleteEmployeeByID: Deletes an employee record from the database based on the employee's ID. This method does not return anything (void)
      Parameters:
      employeeID - the unique identifier of the employee to be deleted

    • deleteEmployeeByEmail

      public void deleteEmployeeByEmail(String email)
      deleteEmployeeByEmail: Deletes an employee record from the database based on the employee's ID. This method does not return anything (void) the unique identifier of the employee to be deleted
      Parameters:
      email -

    • getAllEmployees

      public List<Employee> getAllEmployees()
      getAllEmployees: Retrieves a list of all employees from the database. This method returns a List containing all the employee records retrieved from the database.
      Returns:
      a list of Employee objects containing all employee records

    • getEmployeesByFilter

      public List<Employee> getEmployeesByFilter(String department, String jobTitle, double minSalary, double maxSalary)
      getEmployeesByFilter: Retrieves a list of employees based on the specified filter criteria. The method returns a List containing the employee records that match the specified filter criteria. If no records are found, the method returns an empty list.
      Parameters:
      department - the department to filter by (can be empty for no filter)
      jobTitle - the job title to filter by (can be empty for no filter)
      minSalary - the minimum salary to filter by (0 for no minimum)
      maxSalary - the maximum salary to filter by (Double.MAX_VALUE for no maximum)
      Returns:
      a list of Employee objects that match the specified filter criteria
